objections.name: No Capital/Funds
variations: I don't have the capital right now
I don't have the funds
Can't afford this
I don't have the money
Funds are tight right now
I don't have a credit card with that limit

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: Finances are a precious conversation. Naturally, their guard is going to be a little bit up.
matt.primary_script: Is it a case, let's say we're doing Bronze, right? Is it the case you've got the full $6,000 that's, you know, just a little bit difficult or scary to invest? Or do you have some of it when you look at breaking it up into a more manageable structure? Or you've got none of it at all, and we need to go to the bank or something.
matt.why_it_works: That last bit takes the air out of the room. Immediately categorizes the situation into three clear paths. Reduces defensiveness by normalizing all three scenarios.

follow_up_paths.has_full_amount: If they have the full amount, and it's scary to invest, then you obviously just go into objection handling, whatever fear that is.
follow_up_paths.has_some: If God dropped $6K in your lap right now, would you be ready to move forward? Or would you want to go away and maybe spend that on a holiday somewhere?
follow_up_paths.has_none: Sweet, not a problem, man. If we're able to break it into a more manageable structure that does work for you, does that help you move forward today?

matt.key_question: I guess, you know, for you, really, based on your finances right now, how much do you have able and willing to invest in yourself so that you can take that first step to achieving [their Holy Grail]?
key_principles: TODAY being the very emphasis key
If they say no, you know it's fair and need to go into objection handling
Finance is the easy bit - focus on their commitment first

scholarship_reframe.script: We have a scholarship program that can lower your entry cost
scholarship_reframe.why_it_works: Frames discount as earned/deserved, not desperate sales tactic. Makes prospect feel special/selected.

tax_deduction_angle.script: This is a business expense, fully tax deductible. Your CPA will love this - it's good debt, not bad debt.
tax_deduction_angle.why_it_works: Reframes cost as investment that reduces tax burden

extended_financing.script: $575/month too high? We can extend to 36-60 months, get you to $200/month
extended_financing.why_it_works: Makes program accessible without lowering price, preserves value perception while solving cash flow objection

machine_discount_math.script: You save $500 per machine. Buy 2 machines = program pays for itself. After year 1, it's only $99/month - one machine covers that.
machine_discount_math.why_it_works: Concrete ROI calculation that's easy to visualize

out_of_pocket_timeline.script: Can you do $1,000-$1,200 out of pocket for month 1 and month 2? By month 3-4, machines are covering the program cost.
out_of_pocket_timeline.why_it_works: Specific, short-term commitment feels manageable. Shows path to self-funding business.

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.philosophy: I don't want anyone to force the money out. The key question is whether they have a source.
scott.primary_script: First thing I want to see... do you have a source? Do you have it in the bank? Do you have access to credit? Do you have a family member that can lend it to you? I don't need to know who, I don't need to know what... I just want to know if you have a source or not.

pathway_scripts.has_source: Okay perfect. So you could do the $5,900, you just don't want to? What's your thought process for that?
pathway_scripts.no_source: Before I talk about that, I need to make sure you're qualified first. What are some of the things that have gotten in the way of your credit in the past?
pathway_scripts.credit_issues: Okay, so what would you say you've done about that so far? How long has that been?

scott.payment_plan_pitch: So the way that the payment plan works, because it is a third party company, they want to ensure it's someone who's serious and can afford the investment. What credit score do you think you're rocking right now?
scott.reframe_investment: It's really hard to lose money with something like this because unlike you getting a loan for a car... With a car payment, you spend the money, you don't get it back. Even if you finance the $5,900 and you pay $200-250 extra dollars, you still OWN THE BUSINESS.
key_principles: One sale - can it do it or not

sub_objections.name: Credit Card Limit Issue
sub_objections.script_matt: Look, brother, like finance is the easy bit, not to worry. So what's really more important to me is your commitment. Like if we can find something that does work for you again, like does that help you move forward?
sub_objections.script_scott: Have you looked at getting a credit line increase?
sub_objections.note: Often a mask for another objection - probe deeper

sub_objections.name: Don't Want Debt
sub_objections.script_matt: Of course, it's not a case of debt. Like I go heavy on my pitch about how the business pays for the business and its investment in itself.
sub_objections.script_scott: It's really hard to lose money with something like this because unlike a car loan... you spend the money, you don't get it back. With this, you still OWN THE BUSINESS.
sub_objections.note: Reframe debt as investment that generates returns

objections.warning: Only qualify out if someone is truly unable to invest - dead broke. Otherwise, keep working.

objections.name: Sticker Shock / More Expensive Than Expected
variations: It's more expensive than I thought
That's a lot of money
I was thinking more like $2k-$3k
That's way more than I expected

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: Never ever do silence after a price drop like a cliffhanger - it's awkward and weird.
matt.price_drop_script: Yeah so Adam look, you know, next steps is of course that investment of $6,000 USD. If you're ready to get started what we normally do is get you onboarded on the call, we send over a contract and we get you essentially access to everything so that you can take that first step and start building up this vending route, so you can start to actually not only bring in those 10k months but also leave the job, spend more time with the family. All comes down to you and how you're feeling man.

response_to_shock.step1_agree: Look man, like, agree, first of like, it is expensive, right, don't get me wrong, it's not a cup of coffee.
response_to_shock.step2_reframe: What you want is also a lot there, right, would that be fair to say? Like, it's not just the ability to sort of leave your job and to bring in some income, but it's more so about the ability to build something so that you can actually live life on your own terms.
response_to_shock.step3_future_pace: The version of you 12 months down the line who's got all of that, would you look back and think, like, that was not worth $6,000?

matt.program_reframe: Just to be on the same page, it's not just a program, right? This isn't like a plug and play thing you just come in and you just learn some things. This is coaching, mentorship, guidance, having the systems and the people in place so that you can transform X, Y, Z to X, Y, Z.
matt.key_point: PROGRAM is a horrific word - always reframe as coaching/mentorship

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.philosophy: When people complain about price, it's rarely about the money - it's about value perception.
scott.primary_script: That's totally understandable. Can I ask - when you saw our stuff online, what did you think the investment was going to be?
scott.value_reframe: So here's the thing - you're not just paying for information. You're paying for the shortcut. You're paying for access to relationships we've built. You're paying for someone to actually answer the phone when you have questions.
scott.roi_pitch: If this program helps you get to just ONE location making $1,000/month profit, how many months until you've made back the investment? And that's just ONE machine.

venhub_savings.note: Always mention VenHub savings - between $300 to $1,700 on equipment

objections.name: Need to Talk to Spouse
variations: I need to talk to my wife first
I need to discuss with my husband
Let me run it by my spouse
My partner needs to be involved
We make financial decisions together

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: 90% of the time, spouse/partner is a mask. It's uncovering something else.

buy_in_framework.step1: Do you believe XYZ can work to get you to here?
buy_in_framework.step2: Get double buy-in - have them explain WHY
buy_in_framework.step3: And you know your partner, John, right? Like, is he on board with not just vending, but you setting up a system so you can provide more for the family?
buy_in_framework.step4: Sweet man. In the past, has anything ever come up or gotten in the way of you two when it comes to making a decision similar to this?

responsibility_frame.setup: Your partner, what does she do for work? [Beauty technician] When she's at the salon doing her thing, making decisions, putting everything in place to make sure her role is a success - she doesn't rely on you to make any of those decisions for her, right?
responsibility_frame.pivot: Why would it be fair for you to go away, have that conversation, and put some of the decision and responsibility for your future, for your life, and ultimately your family as the man of the household, and push any of that decision onto her?
responsibility_frame.clarify: I'm not saying she can't be there to lean on. But when it comes to the decision and responsibility to take the first step, whose responsibility does that fall on?
responsibility_frame.close: The version of you who's got X, Y, Z and this amazing family - what decision would he make here? Because frankly, I'm not sure it's going away and outsourcing that responsibility to anyone else.

matt.ceo_frame: You are the man of the house - you're almost like the CEO of your own household. Similar to a CEO running a business, would he put any of those decisions for what's best for the business, and ultimately for the employees (your family), onto them?

send_them_everything.script: I'll send you all the info so you can review with [spouse/partner]. Let's schedule a follow-up call with both of you on it.
send_them_everything.why_it_works: Respects decision-making process, doesn't try to bypass

division_of_labor.script: Who's doing what? One person finds locations, other restocks? How much does this need to make for you to cut back hours?
division_of_labor.why_it_works: Gets them planning together, building shared vision

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.philosophy: Figure out if spouse is a real barrier or a smokescreen. Most times it's fear.
discovery_questions: Is your spouse generally supportive of you starting a business?
What do you think their main concern would be?
If they said yes, would you be ready to move forward today?
scott.three_way_call: Would it help if we got them on a quick call together? I'm happy to answer any questions they might have.
scott.key_insight: If they won't do a three-way call, it's usually not really about the spouse

protocol: Address financing FIRST with specific numbers
IMMEDIATELY schedule three-way call with spouse
DO NOT send info and wait

objections.name: Not Ready to Start Right Now
variations: I'm not ready to start right now
I want to wait a few months
Maybe next quarter
I want to start in Q1 2026
I'll call you back in 6 months

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: Means you've probably done a poor discovery when it comes to urgency. Or it's a mask.
matt.discovery_urgency_question: Knowing that those right tools and resources are out there, just a handful to grab away, and you can change your life - you being in the current position where you can't do X, Y, Z, and you're stuck in that box - how much longer, how many months, weeks, or even days are you okay actually staying in the same position?
matt.buy_in_approach: 'Not ready to start right now' isn't an objection. Ask: 'Is it a case that, you know, like, if you did do this, and you were to implement XYZ, do you feel that it could ever get to XYZ?' Then get them to explain why.
matt.opportunity_cost: Brother, if you're going to do this regardless, why would it make sense to delay it? When in Q1 2026, you might already have 2 or 3 machines.
matt.key_principle: Always try to close now. Not even if it's literally impossible - at least a payment is a sign of commitment.

analysis_paralysis_warning.script: I don't want you stuck in analysis paralysis, wishing you'd pulled the trigger 6 months from now
analysis_paralysis_warning.why_it_works: Creates urgency without pressure. Appeals to regret avoidance (loss aversion psychology).

ramp_up_while_you_wait.script: Start learning now, hit the ground running in 2-3 months when you're ready. Get knowledgeable, build skillset, don't play catch-up later.
ramp_up_while_you_wait.why_it_works: Reframes waiting as wasting time vs. preparing

life_will_never_be_perfect.script: There's always going to be something - wedding, training, move, baby. The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. Second best time is today.
life_will_never_be_perfect.why_it_works: Normalizes imperfect timing, encourages action despite obstacles

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.philosophy: Timing objections usually mask fear or lack of urgency established in discovery.
scott.response: I totally get that. Can I ask - what specifically needs to happen between now and then for you to feel ready?
scott.follow_up: And if those things happened today, would you be ready to move forward?
scott.urgency_builder: Here's the thing - every month you wait is a month of potential income you're leaving on the table. What if you had started 6 months ago?

sub_objections.name: Too Busy / Job's Crazy
sub_objections.script_matt: Busy is great, right? In fact, I wouldn't want you to ever not be busy, whether that's work, family, vacations. Busy is part of a great life. Would you agree? Ultimately for you, is it a case of like it's impossible for you to invest 5 to 10 hours a week to achieve X, Y, Z, Holy Grail?
sub_objections.priorities_push: I know you've been trying this for the last two years. Being in this loop of being busy has ultimately kept you in the same position. In order to break that, do you feel that by doing the same thing over and over, you're actually going to break that spell?
sub_objections.final_push: Is this dream future where you spend all this time with the family and create memories as a man, have that financial freedom - is that not worth 5 hours a week to you?

objections.name: Need Time to Think
variations: I need time to think about it
Let me sleep on it
I'll get back to you
I need to do more research
I'll call you in a week

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: Think about it is bullshit. There's no one who needs to think about things. There's a real reason why. Never do a follow-up on 'think about it.'
matt.core_question: I guess when you go away and take that time, what's coming up that makes you want to think about it?
matt.research_response: Brother, with the greatest respect, the research is right here, right? You can go away, do some research, do some Googles. Ultimately, by speaking with the company, you're getting the most accurate information. So in terms of things that you're looking for, what is it you're looking for that we might not have gotten over?

processing_response.decision_reframe: In life, would it be fair to say that the way we make decisions has led us to where we are now? The decisions you've made and how you've made them up to this point has led you to the exact point you're in now, right?
processing_response.pivot: Frankly, man, my job here is to help you change the way you make decisions. If you keep making decisions on 'I need to think about it' and take time and really not take that first step, what do you think is going to happen?
processing_response.certainty_close: If you were 100% certain that if you did this today, that within 12 months, you'd be at that 10K mark and you'd leave the job, you'd be biting my hand off, right? So what's coming up that makes you not quite 100% certain right now?

matt.pattern_interrupt: I'll call you in a week? No, you won't. You'll no-show me. Come on now, man. What's going on?

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.philosophy: They already have all the information they need. The real issue is something else.
scott.discovery: What specifically do you need to think about? Is it the money, the time commitment, or something else?
scott.reframe: I get wanting to think about it. But here's what I've found - most people who say they need to think about it never come back. Not because they don't want to, but because life gets in the way. What would help you make a decision today?

objections.warning: 31% win rate on 'think about it' - one of the hardest objections. Must crack the mask immediately.

objections.name: I Can Do This Myself
variations: I can figure this out on my own
I'll just learn from YouTube
Why can't I just do it myself?
I don't need coaching
I can find locations myself

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: Cook their logic - if they could do it themselves, they already would have. They're on the call because they need help.
matt.core_strategy: Their logic is flawed because they believe they can run this themselves. That logic is flawed because if they could do that, they already would have done it and they're on the call because they need help.
matt.opportunity_cost: By having the right people in place and by investing in mentorship over the next 2, 3, 4 months, the opportunity cost of what they'd miss out on - if they were to try on their own, their snowball would not have created as much.
matt.value_pitch: It's not just a case of having the tools and the resources, but also building the skills to utilize your tools and resources. So over the next 5, 10, 15 years, as you grow this business, expand into other ventures, grow your family - you have the ability to rely on yourself.

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.philosophy: Acknowledge they CAN do it themselves - the question is how fast and at what cost.
scott.response: You absolutely can do this yourself. The question is - do you want to spend the next 2 years figuring it out through trial and error, or do you want to compress that into 90 days with someone who's already made all the mistakes?
scott.cost_calculation: What's your time worth? If you value your time at even $25/hour, and you spend 200 hours figuring things out that we could teach you in 20 hours, that's $4,500 in time alone. Plus all the mistakes you'll make along the way.

rep_performance.note: Lyle struggles here - 25% win rate vs 76% team average
rep_performance.lyle_coaching: DO NOT offer VenHub-only on this objection. Defend full program value.

objections.name: Want Business to Pay For It
variations: I want to wait until my business can pay for it
Let me get started and pay later
I'll call you back in 6 months once I'm making money
I want the business to fund the coaching

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: Cook their logic - the foundations of the house, the building blocks are the most important.
matt.logic_flaw: Their decision has already been made to get help and to build this with the right systems around them. If they could run this themselves and pay for it, they already would have.
matt.opportunity_cost: By having the right people in place over the next 2, 3, 4 months, the opportunity cost of what they'd miss out on if they tried on their own - their snowball would not have created as much.

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.response: I totally understand wanting the business to pay for itself. Here's the challenge - without the right foundation, the business might never get to that point. It's like saying 'I'll go to the gym once I'm in shape.'
scott.reframe: The investment in coaching IS the business paying for itself - it's the fastest path to profitability.

objections.name: How Does Financing Work?
variations: How does financing work exactly?
What are the payment options?
Can I pay monthly?
What credit score do I need?
What if I pay it off early?

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: Don't spend 5-10 minutes going down options only to find out they're not eligible. Find that out first.
matt.discovery_first: Look, so we have different options. It depends on your scenario. For you, would you be using credit card, debit card, what would you be using?
matt.eligibility_check: Depending on which one you go for, you have to have the full available limit because they put it on a hold to make sure you are eligible. Would that work for you, or should we look at another option?
matt.fee_explanation: Yeah, like, obviously, essentially, it's $6 grand. If you split it up over a few months, it does add a little bit more. If we pay in full, it does work out a little bit cheaper.
matt.early_payoff: There's not a penalty - if they're 3 months in and pay the rest off, they pay it off without the 15% of those remaining months.
matt.credit_score: What's your credit score, man? Depending on what credit score you have, we have different options.

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.explanation: So the way the payment plan works - because it is a third party company, they want to ensure it's someone who's serious. What credit score do you think you're rocking right now?
scott.roi_frame: Talk about by month X, you're already making the return of the investment. The business can then pay for the business.

objections.name: Expected More for the Price
variations: For that price, I'd expect you to find locations for me
What if I just want to pay less and do it myself?
I thought I'd get more done-for-you
Why doesn't this include location sourcing?

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.pattern_interrupt: I'm not sure how much you'd expect for that, but I mean, whatever price, we can just throw Mike in your spare bedroom if you like, and he can come do it for you.
matt.note: Use humor to break tension, then probe for real concern
matt.analysis: This could be hidden in logistics OR hidden in fear. Could be fear of self - what if I don't get results, first time doing something. Or could be actual logistics concern.
matt.value_pitch: It's not just a case of having the tools and resources, but also building the skills to utilize them. Over the next 5, 10, 15, 20 years, as you grow this business, expand into other ventures - you have the ability to rely on yourself. As a business owner, you can't continue to outsource everything.

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.response: I hear you. Let me ask - would you rather we find you ONE location, or would you rather learn how to find UNLIMITED locations yourself?
scott.long_term: We're not just trying to get you one machine placed. We're trying to build you a skill set that will serve you for the rest of your life.

objections.tier_note: Platinum does include location sourcing - make sure you understand which tier they're discussing

objections.name: Need to Talk to Business Partner/Consultant
variations: I need to talk to my business partner
Let me discuss with my consultant
My financial advisor needs to review this
I have a mentor I consult on decisions

matt.name: Matt Chubb
matt.philosophy: Similar to spouse - try to create responsibility. See if one of them is ultimately the decision maker.
matt.for_external_consultant: Easy responsibility frame - same as spouse. Just raise the responsibility angle.
matt.for_real_partner: Try and get them to call. Or if one is the decision maker: '50-50, right? I guess one of you is the decision maker. One of you is marketing, one's operations. Great. You run operations. This is part of an operation, right?'

scott.name: Scott Seymour
scott.discovery: Is this person a partner in this specific venture, or more of a general advisor?
scott.three_way: Would it make sense to get them on a quick call? I'm happy to walk through everything with both of you.

two_objections.note: 38% win rate with 2 objections vs 54% with single objection

three_plus_objections.script: On a scale of 1-10, how serious are you about starting a vending business in the next 90 days?
three_plus_objections.threshold: IF BELOW 7: Qualify out. IF 7+: Let's identify the ONE thing really holding you back

protocol: Address financing FIRST with specific numbers
IMMEDIATELY schedule three-way call with spouse
DO NOT send info and wait
Get spouse on three-way before ending call

objection_clustering.description: Certain objections tend to appear together

matt_principles: Cook their logic - find the flaw in their reasoning
Buy-in and double buy-in - get them to explain WHY
90% of the time it's a mask - dig deeper
Pattern interrupt when they're bullshitting you
Go back to the Holy Grail - tie to their ultimate goal
TODAY is the key word - create commitment now
Never silence after price drop - connect to value
Win the responsibility frame with spouse objections
scott_principles: One sale - can they do it or not
It's really hard to lose money with this
universal_rules: Never skip discovery - most objections come from poor discovery
Urgency must be built in discovery, not objection handling

local_social_proof.script: Do you have anybody in [their city] doing this? Yes, [Name] has [X] machines, does $[Y]/month in sales. I'll see if they have availability for a Q&A.
local_social_proof.why_it_works: Specific numbers + local proximity = credibility. Offer to connect them.

no_timeshare_reassurance.script: This isn't a timeshare presentation. There's no ticking time bomb. Only incentive is 50 leads if you sign up by end of month - that's it.
no_timeshare_reassurance.why_it_works: Explicitly addresses high-pressure sales fear. Builds trust by being transparent about incentives.

we_want_you_to_succeed.script: We're not worried about just getting the deal. We're here for the steps and the process. We want to make sure you want to do it and will be successful.
we_want_you_to_succeed.why_it_works: Positions company as partner, not vendor

family_time.response: Emphasize 6-8 hrs/week, family business involvement, creating memories

physical_exhaustion.response: Vending is not dependent on your body/time, passive income

autonomy.response: Own the business, not dependent on employers, build equity

phrases: Set up my son for college
generational_wealth.response: Family business, involving kids, long-term legacy. This is THE most powerful motivator.

definitely_towards_10.signal: Rep asks 1-10 readiness, prospect says 'Definitely towards the 10'
definitely_towards_10.meaning: Objections handled, vision clear, ready to close

love_everything_seeing.signal: 'I love the support, the contracts, the templates'
love_everything_seeing.meaning: Enthusiasm present even if they claim skepticism
love_everything_seeing.action: Address remaining skepticism, don't re-sell value

lets_talk_pricing.signal: 'If all that's included, let's talk pricing'

family_meeting.signal: 'We should have a family meeting this Sunday'
family_meeting.meaning: Real buying process, not a stall
family_meeting.action: Send materials, offer to join call, schedule follow-up

trust_builders: I'm not gonna be a hard press
I want to make sure you're comfortable
urgency_creators: I don't want you stuck in analysis paralysis
Six months from now, you'll wish you'd started today
price_handlers: It's a real investment to start a company
This is good debt, not bad debt
The program pays for itself with machine discounts
skepticism_overcomers: You're not crazy for thinking that
I get it, there are scams out there
Let me connect you with [specific member] who was in your exact situation
